entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Rebounds From Recent Declines to Start the Weekend
entry.summary:
Bitcoin started the weekend tracking around the $34,000 level, as prices rebounded following a two-day winless run. The cryptocurrency has begun to consolidate in recent days, following strong gains earlier in the week. Ethereum moved back closer to the $1,800 level.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin rose back above the $34,000 level on Saturday, which comes following recent price consolidation.
After hitting a low of $33,416.89 on Friday, BTC/USD rallied to an intraday high of $34,201.77 to start the day.
The move saw bitcoin snap a two-day losing streak, which came after the cryptocurrency was significantly overbought.
Despite the uncertainty of the past few days, the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) remains in this territory.
As of writing, the index is tracking at 81.21, which comes as bulls implemented an interim floor at the 80.00 mark.
If this level holds throughout the weekend, bulls may make another run towards the $35,000 level.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) rebounded from Friday‚Äôs drop, making a run back towards the $1,800 level to start the weekend.
ETH/USD peaked at $1,796.57 on Saturday, which comes after the price fell to a low of $1,751.44 less than 24 hours ago.
This climb means that the world‚Äôs second largest cryptocurrency has traded higher for nine of the last ten sessions.
Looking at the chart, this latest rally comes as the 10-day (red) moving average continues its uptrend versus its 25-day (blue) counterpart.
Additionally, the RSI found a floor at 68.00, using it as a springboard to a current reading of 69.94.
Bulls will likely make further runs towards $1,800, despite overall price strength being overbought.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect ethereum to hit $1,800 this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: South Koreans Fascinated With Altcoins More Than Americans, Research Shows
entry.summary:
South Korean crypto traders are more inclined to invest in high-risk, high-reward altcoins than their American counterparts, according to a new report. The share of major cryptocurrencies like bitcoin and ethereum in the trading volumes on the largest Korean exchange is much smaller than the one registered on the leading U.S. exchange, the research indicates.
Majority of South Korean Investors Interested in Altcoins With Potential for High Profit
Many South Koreans favor a high-risk approach to crypto investments that can potentially return high rewards, the Web3 market strategy consulting firm Despread has established in a new study focused on trading on the country‚Äôs major cryptocurrency exchanges.
‚ÄúThe majority of individual investors on Upbit show strong interest in altcoins wit‚Ä¶

entry.title: State Channels ‚ÄòSignificantly Reduce Congestion and Transaction Fees,‚Äô Ideal for Decentralized Exchanges ‚Äî Louis Bellet
entry.summary:
According to Louis Bellet, the founder of the Layer-3 peer-to-peer protocol Yellow Network, crypto trading has not scaled largely because it remains unregulated in many places which in turn ‚Äúgreatly slows down its growth and produces tons of scams.‚Äù In contrast, traditional finance (tradfi) is widely seen as ‚Äúa well-oiled machine‚Äù and this according to Bellet may be down to the sector‚Äôs ‚Äúwell-established regulatory frameworks and policies in place.‚Äù
State Channels Ideal for Apps Which ‚ÄòRequire Rapid Transactions‚Äô
Still, in his answers sent to Bitcoin.com News, Bellet sought to link traditional finance‚Äôs scalability to the ‚Äúusage of clearing systems.‚Äù He argued that such clearing systems help to ‚Äúmitigate counterparty risks and obviate the need for speedy settlements.‚Äù According to Bell‚Ä¶

entry.title: $720 Million Lost via 117 Hacking Incidents in Q3 of 2023 ‚Äî Study
entry.summary:
During Q3 of 2023, there were a total of 117 hacks in which $720 million was stolen via access control breaches and rug pulls among other security incidents, a new study has found. While the losses ($49.80 million) from rug-pull incidents are significantly lower than the $449 million lost via access control and reentrancy, the study data shows rug-pulling incidents as the most prevalent form of attack.
Human Factor ‚ÄòMost Exposed Part of the Crypto Industry‚Äô
According to the latest Web3 security report by the blockchain security auditor Hacken, there were a total of 117 hacks in Q3 of 2023 while the value of funds stolen in this period topped $720 million. For context, there were 131 hacks in the preceding quarter yet only $327 million was stolen.
As noted in the study report, access ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Alex Jones Lost a 10K-Bitcoin Stash Gifted by Max Keiser ‚Äî Now He Can Regain It Doing a Quiz
entry.summary:
International journalist and Bitcoin maximalist Max Keiser is giving Infowars host Alex Jones the chance of regaining a gift of 10,000 bitcoin he lost. According to Keiser, Jones will have the chance to recover the stash by answering a trivia round consisting of 5 questions. However, Jones has not answered Keiser‚Äôs call at the time of writing.
Max Keiser Will Give Alex Jones Opportunity to Recover 10,000 Bitcoin
Bitcoin enthusiast and journalist Max Keiser took to social networks to allow Infowars host Alex Jones to regain the 10,000 bitcoin he lost when BTC was priced at $5. According to Jones, Max gave him a laptop containing the bitcoin in a meeting, but Jones did not care for the item, which got lost in undisclosed circumstances.
Jones disclosed this loss on a show two years ago,‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance Appoints New Regional Head for Eastern Europe and Central Asia
entry.summary:
Binance‚Äôs General Manager for Central and Eastern Europe, Kyrylo Khomiakov, will take responsibility for Central Asia as well. His promotion comes after the crypto exchange‚Äôs top executives in the region left the company last month, part of a string of executive exits at Binance this year.
Kyrylo Khomiakov to Manage Binance‚Äôs Business in 14 Markets in Central and Eastern Europe and Central Asia
Binance, the largest digital assets exchange by daily trading volume, has appointed Kyrylo Khomiakov as its new regional head for Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) and Central Asia. Until now he was Binance‚Äôs General Manager for CEE.
Khomiakov will manage the company‚Äôs teams, focus on enhancing products and services and optimizing user experience to grow its business, a press release detailed. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Lawmakers Ask DOJ to Consider Criminal Charges Against Binance and Tether
entry.summary:
Two U.S. lawmakers have asked the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) to consider criminal charges against Binance and Tether, alleging that the two crypto platforms were used to fund Hamas. ‚ÄúWe urge the Department of Justice to carefully evaluate the extent to which Binance and Tether are providing material support and resources to support terrorism through violations of applicable sanctions laws and the Bank Secrecy Act,‚Äù the lawmakers stressed.
Lawmakers Concerned About Binance and Tether
The office of U.S. Senator Cynthia Lummis (R-WY) announced Thursday that the senator from Wyoming and U.S. Representative French Hill (R-AR) have sent a letter to U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland urging the Department of Justice (DOJ) ‚Äúto swiftly investigate Binance and Tether.‚Äù They alleged that‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Admits Limited Cryptocurrency Knowledge During Fraud Trial
entry.summary:
During the ongoing trial of Sam Bankman-Fried, co-founder of the now-defunct FTX crypto exchange, startling revelations have emerged regarding his understanding of cryptocurrency.
FTX Co-Founder‚Äôs Shocking Testimony¬†
According to live coverage of the trial by The Guardian, Bankman-Fried confessed to knowing ‚Äúbasically nothing‚Äù about cryptocurrency before launching FTX and its affiliated hedge fund, Alameda Research. On the stand, Bankman-Fried admitted:
I had absolutely no idea how they worked. I just knew they were things you could trade.
According to the report, when Bankman-Fried teamed up with co-founder Gary Wang, who testified against him in the trial, they had no idea how to attract customers.¬†
As for FTX‚Äôs collapse, US Attorney Mark Cohen‚Äôs questioning suggested that t‚Ä¶

entry.title: New Law Expands Police Powers to Seize Crypto in UK
entry.summary:
A new law that gives law enforcement agencies greater powers to seize, freeze, and recover crypto assets has entered into force in the U.K. The law introduces provisions for police to ‚Äúseize crypto assets more easily and convert them into money before a forfeiture hearing has taken place,‚Äù the British government explained, adding: ‚ÄúIn exceptional circumstances, there will also be a power to destroy seized cryptocurrency.‚Äù
Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Act 2023
The U.K. government announced Thursday that the Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Act 2023, which aims to ‚Äúfight fraud, counter corruption, and bolster legitimate business,‚Äù has received Royal Assent. After being introduced to Parliament in September 2022, the bill underwent a year of debate and amendments bef‚Ä¶

entry.title: Nobody Cares About Bitcoin (BTC) In The US: Google Trends
entry.summary:
If Google Trends¬†data is anything to go by, it could mean that Americans don‚Äôt care about Bitcoin (BTC) or the interest is ultra-low and falling despite the series of bullish events in the last few days.¬†
Americans Are Not Interested In Bitcoin?
A spot check of Google Trends over the past years shows that not only are searches related to ‚Äúbuy Bitcoin‚Äù discouragingly falling but are at 2023 lows, with related average daily searches scoring less than 20. The only time ‚Äúbuy Bitcoin‚Äù searches spiked was in early September when it rose to a score of 70, an indicator that more people were curious, willing to explore, and even buy the world‚Äôs most valuable coin.
Sentiment is a crucial factor in crypto because it can influence prices. To illustrate, when sentiment improves, crypto inve‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Considering 8-10 Spot Bitcoin ETF Applications, Says Chair Gary Gensler
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is currently considering between eight and 10 bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) applications, according to SEC Chairman Gary Gensler. He insisted that ‚Äúthe vast majority of crypto assets likely meet the investment contract test, making them subject to the securities laws.‚Äù
SEC Chair Gary Gensler on Spot Bitcoin ETFs
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chairman Gary Gensler said Thursday that the regulator has eight to 10 spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) applications under review. The SEC has not yet approved a spot bitcoin ETF, even though the agency has greenlighted several ETFs linked to bitcoin futures contracts.
Regarding bitcoin ETF decisions, the SEC chairman stated:
They‚Äôll come potentially to the five-memb‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Speaks Out: Admits Mistakes as FTX's CEO
entry.summary: Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) faced the jury yesterday (Friday) and acknowledged the widespread fallout when the cryptocurrency exchange FTX, which he co-founded, crumbled. BBC reported that the 31-year-old entrepreneur, accused of deceiving investors and embezzling customer funds, opened up about his actions and decisions that led to this point. "A lot of people got hurt, customers, employees, and the company ended up in bankruptcy," he added. Throughout his testimony at the Manhattan federal court, SBF admitted to making a series of errors, both minor and significant, while managing the now-defunct exchange. entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: Clip: DeepMedia's DeepID Deepfake Detection Tool at Work
entry.summary: A clip showcasing how DeepMedia's DeepID deepfake detection tool works. Courtesy: DeepMedia

entry.title: Decentraland AI World Fair Trailer
entry.summary: A trailer for the AI World Fair event in metaverse game Decentraland, taking place from October 25-27. Courtesy: Decentraland.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.
Our Host: https://twitter.com/rezajafery Our Guest: https://twitter.com/BackTheBunny
Our Sponsors https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 and Trezor Keep Metal Unboxing
entry.summary: Trezor has launched the Safe 3, a hardware wallet aimed at "new entrants to crypto," alongside the new Keep Metal recovery seed storage device. We take a first look at what comes in the box.

entry.title: Why AI Arena is Building on Arbitrum
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss the challenges that come with building on Ethereum, ETH sidechains, and layer-two blockchains.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.
Our guest for today's episode is Pet3rpan_ from Metacartel, 1kx, HydraVentures, and more!
https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_
This Time Will Be Different is sponsored by 1000x https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, we‚Äôll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.

entry.title: Martin Shkreli on E/ACC and SBF in Prison
entry.summary: Reza Jafery and Martin Shkreli sit down for a casual conversation about the growing movement that is E/ACC, what songs they could recite at gunpoint, and whether or not SBF will thrive or just survive during his time in prison.

entry.title: What Can AI Do in Gaming?
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss how artificial intelligence can shape the video game experience.

entry.title: 'There Are No Real Standards': Ready Player Me CEO Timmu T√µke on Building for an Open Gaming Ecosystem
entry.summary: Timmu T√µke, co-founder and CEO of Ready Player Me, joins Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin to discuss the startup's approach to powering avatars that are interoperable across games and metaverse platforms‚Äîand what's needed to convince the industry to adopt standards and open up.
